abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Project Completion Report on
            Zaire - Navigation Improvement Project. Project objectives
            were to maintain adequate navigation channels in the Zaire
            estuary and river. Project implementation was partial.
            Objectives were not reached; despite sizeable procurement of
            equipment, channels were not maintained; the performance of
            the executing agencies deteriorated. Its outcome is rated as
            unsatisfactory, its sustainability as unlikely, and its
            institutional impact as negligible. Lessons learned
            included: 1) A public enterprise lacking the autonomy to
            adjust to the declining economic conditions is not viable
            under such conditions; and 2) During implementation, it
            became clear that neither Sea Traffic Authority (RVM) nor
            River Traffic Authority (RVF) was experienced in dealing
            with Bank procurement procedures. This could be prevented in
            the future by training and through appropriate seminars.

docna.cdata!:
China - Second Technical Cooperation Project
            : Credit 1664 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
China - Second Technical
            Cooperation Project : Credit 1664 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

18155928.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Technical Cooperation Project
            is to assist the Government in preparing projects that are
            expected to be financed by IBRD/IDA and to help develop
            capacity for preparing and implementing investment projects
            and administering technical assistance. The project will
            consist of technical assistance and training subprojects
            which will be selected by agreement between the Government
            and the IDA. Most of the subprojects will support project
            preparation. A few subprojects will be aimed primarily at
            strengthening the core agencies and other institutions
            involved with Bank operations. Others will provide for
            economic and policy studies to be carried out by research agencies.
